Printing Shop of Chosun Ilbo Torched 
    Pyongyang, June 26 (KCNA) -- A south Korean surnamed An residing in Sihung, Kyonggi Province, set fire to the printing shop of the daily Chosun Ilbo on June 17, according to the south Korean KBS.
 An was reported to have asserted that the pro-Japanese and treacherous newspaper Chosun Ilbo should cease to exist. That day he set fire to a heap of waste paper in the printing shop in Kasan-dong, Kumchon District in Seoul, in token of protest.    
 He formed the organization called the group to force Chosun Ilbo to cease its publication last March and has since carried on the actions against the treacherous reptile daily, the report said.

Yemeni Prime Minister Meets DPRK Government Economic Delegation 
    Pyongyang, June 26 (KCNA) -- Prime Minister of the Yemeni Cabinet Abdul Kader Ba-Jammal met and had a friendly talk with the DPRK government economic delegation headed by Minister of Foreign Trade Rim Kyong Man on a visit to Yemen. 
 Present there were Yemeni Minister of Industry and Commerce Khalid Rajeh Sheikh and officials concerned.

Booklet on Comradeship of Kim Jong Il Published in Italy
    Pyongyang, June 25 (KCNA) -- The Group of Dialectical Materialists and Atheists of Italy published the booklet  "Kim Jong Il, 40 Odd Years of His Comradeship" on June 15 on the occasion of the 41st anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il's start of work at the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea.
 The booklet said: Kim Jong Il has performed great feats over the last four decades and these feats are based on his comradeship. He was present at the operation on an official to save him from the jaws of death. He made sure that the remains of dead officials were moved to the martyrs' cemetery.    
 Recalling that he visited units of the Korean People's Army, factories, farms, schools and dwelling houses to show comradeship for ordinary people, the booklet stressed that thanks to his comradeship all the members of the society are united closely and the Korean people have emerged victorious in the struggle to defend socialism.

articles.content:
Greetings to Madagascan President
    Pyongyang, June 25 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Thursday sent a message of greetings to Madagascan President Marc Ravalomanana on the occasion of the 45th anniversary of the independence of Madagascar. 
 Expressing the belief that the friendly relations between the two countries would continue to grow stronger, the message sincerely wished the president and the people of Madagascar greater successes in their efforts for the prosperity and development of the country.

Greetings to Mozambican President
    Pyongyang, June 25 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Saturday sent a message of greetings to Mozambican President Armando Emilio Guebuza on the occasion of the 30th anniversary of the independence of Mozambique. 
 The Korean people, the message said, are very rejoiced over the great achievements made by the Mozambican people in their work to achieve stability, peace and socio-economic development of the country in 30 years after the independence.    
 Expressing the belief that the traditional relations of friendship and cooperation between the two countries would further develop in the mutual interests of the two peoples, the message sincerely wished the president greater success in his responsible work for the prosperity of the country.
